page.title: 05Housing.
page.content:
The biggest use of land in the built up area is for housing, and the vast majority of houses are of the Victorian terraced variety. These were built to house the mill workers when Burnley was a prosperous cotton-town. The occupants of these houses own their own homes and many would wish to live in no other sort of house.
There is however a large estate of 1970's semi-detached, privately owned houses, and an equally large council estate of all-but derilict property with about one house in ten still inhabited. The rest are subject to vandalism, with the area being regarded as unsafe.
